meanings.definition: Obtain or withhold money from (someone) by deceit or without justification.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist bilks unsuspecting victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent2: The con artist bilks people by promising fake investment opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat bilks the dog out of its treats by pretending to be hungry.
meanings.sent4: The clever magician bilks the audience's attention with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The crafty fox bilks the chickens out of their eggs by pretending to be their friend.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest salesman bilks customers by selling them faulty products.
meanings.sent2: The swindler bilks innocent people out of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun bilks the children out of their candy on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The cunning thief bilks the museum of its priceless artifacts under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The deceptive pirate bilks the sailors of their treasures with his clever disguises.
